input: Draft a treaty provision establishing a verification regime for compliance with a ban on lethal autonomous weapons systems, including provisions for technical inspections, challenge inspections, and a scientific advisory board.
target: States Parties shall permit inspections of facilities developing autonomous weapons-capable systems by designated technical experts. Challenge inspections upon 48 hours notice shall be permitted. A Scientific Advisory Board of 15 independent experts shall assess compliance annually.

input: Create a provision establishing international standards for AI systems used in critical infrastructure, including requirements for human oversight, failsafe mechanisms, and cross-border incident notification.
target: AI systems operating critical infrastructure shall maintain human override capability at all times, implement automatic failsafe shutdown on anomaly detection, and operators shall notify affected States within 24 hours of any incident affecting cross-border services.

input: Draft a provision governing the allocation of liability for autonomous shipping vessels in international waters, addressing collisions, environmental damage, and cargo loss.
target: The flag State of an autonomous vessel shall bear primary liability for collisions and environmental damage. Operators shall maintain insurance of at least [SDR amount] per vessel. Cargo liability shall follow existing maritime conventions with autonomous operation not constituting force majeure.

input: Create a provision establishing an international framework for AI safety incident reporting and investigation, modeled on aviation safety investigation principles.
target: States Parties shall report AI safety incidents causing death, serious injury, or critical infrastructure failure to the International AI Safety Board within 72 hours. The Board shall conduct independent investigations with full access to source code and training data. Findings shall be non-punitive and publicly available.

input: Draft a provision establishing rights and obligations related to the use of AI in military targeting decisions, balancing military necessity with international humanitarian law requirements.
target: AI systems supporting targeting decisions shall not select or engage individual human targets without contemporaneous human authorization. Commanders shall retain responsibility for all targeting decisions. AI recommendations shall be documented and preserved for post-engagement review.

input: Create a provision establishing a framework for cross-border data flows necessary for climate monitoring while protecting national sovereignty and data security.
target: States Parties shall share climate monitoring data through the designated Global Climate Data Exchange within 30 days of collection. National security exemptions may apply to specific data categories upon notification to the Secretariat. The Exchange shall maintain cybersecurity standards equivalent to ISO 27001.

input: Draft a provision establishing an international dispute resolution mechanism for conflicts arising from the extraterritorial application of AI regulations.
target: Disputes concerning extraterritorial application of AI regulations shall be referred to an AI Regulatory Disputes Panel of five experts. Parties shall provide affected operators 90 days notice before extraterritorial enforcement. Panel decisions shall be binding pending appeal to the Appellate Body.

input: Create a provision establishing requirements for algorithmic auditing of AI systems used in financial services, including independence requirements and scope of review.
target: AI systems making or supporting decisions on credit, insurance, or investment shall undergo annual audits by certified independent auditors. Audits shall assess training data for prohibited discrimination, validate model performance against stated accuracy claims, and review human override statistics.

input: Draft a provision establishing an international framework for governing AI-generated disinformation in the context of electoral integrity.
target: States Parties shall require platforms to label AI-generated content in electoral contexts within 24 hours of detection. Cross-border disinformation campaigns shall be reported to the Electoral Integrity Monitoring Body. States shall not use AI to generate disinformation targeting other States' elections.

input: Create a provision establishing obligations for the decommissioning of AI systems, including requirements for data deletion, model destruction, and transition support.
target: Operators decommissioning high-risk AI systems shall delete training data containing personal information within 90 days, maintain audit logs for 5 years, notify affected individuals of system discontinuation 60 days in advance, and provide transition support to alternative services where the system provided essential functions.

input: Draft a provision establishing requirements for AI systems used in criminal sentencing, including transparency, appeal rights, and prohibition of certain factors.
target: AI systems supporting sentencing recommendations shall disclose all factors and weights to the defendant prior to sentencing. Defendants shall have the right to human-only sentencing upon request. Systems shall not consider race, ethnicity, religion, or socioeconomic status directly or through proxies.

input: Create a provision establishing an international moratorium on the development of recursive self-improving AI systems, with verification mechanisms.
target: States Parties shall not develop, deploy, or permit the development of AI systems capable of modifying their own architecture to improve capabilities without human authorization. Facilities with computational capacity exceeding [threshold] shall permit international inspections. Violations shall be reported to the Security Council.

input: Draft a provision establishing a framework for the governance of AI systems operating in international waters and airspace.
target: AI systems operating vessels or aircraft in international waters or airspace shall comply with the International AI Navigation Code. Flag States shall certify AI navigation systems annually. Systems shall maintain continuous communication with monitoring authorities and implement automatic return-to-base upon communication loss exceeding 4 hours.

input: Create a provision establishing requirements for AI systems used in climate modeling and policy recommendations, including transparency and scientific review.
target: AI systems producing climate projections used in policy decisions shall be subject to peer review by the Intergovernmental Scientific Panel. Model architectures and training methodologies shall be published. Projections shall include uncertainty ranges and explicit identification of model limitations.

input: Draft a provision establishing mutual recognition of AI safety certifications between jurisdictions, including minimum standards and dispute resolution.
target: States Parties shall recognize AI safety certifications issued by other Parties' designated conformity assessment bodies, provided such bodies meet minimum standards set out in Annex IV. Disputes concerning recognition shall be referred to the Joint Technical Committee, which shall issue non-binding recommendations within 60 days.
